Lloydâ€™s chickens lay 252 eggs each day.  
Weekly production: \(252 \text{ eggs/day} \times 7 \text{ days} = 1764 \text{ eggs/week}\).

He sells eggs at $2 per dozen.  
Price per egg = \(\dfrac{2}{12} = \$0.166666\ldots\).

Weekly earnings: \(1764 \text{ eggs} \times \$0.166666\ldots \approx \$294\).

So Lloyd makes **$294 per week**.
